# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

Based on the task description, here's the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(words, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = ""
        end

        current_line *= " $word"
    end

    if !isempty(current_line)
        push!(lines, current_line)
    end

    join(lines, "\n")
end
```

Here's an example usage of the function:

```julia
words = split("The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.")
wrapped_text = wrap_string(words)

println(wrapped_text)
```

This will output the text wrapped to fit within a width of 10 characters per line.
